Coding Made AI—Now, How Will AI Unmake Coding?
X.ST: It won’t replace many coding jobs, but many coding jobs will be increasingly AI-assisted

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The subtitle says it all.

X.T: Replit’s Ghostwriter AI can explain programs to you—or help write them
X.ST: Ghostwriter generates, completes, or transforms code in 16 languages, similar to GitHub Copilot.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The subtitle says it all.

X.T: DeepMind’s latest AI project solves programming challenges like a newb
X.ST: Google's AI division tackles programming languages with a language model.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: DeepMind tries to create an AI generating code, the results are still not good.

X.T: L’IA va-t-elle changer notre métier de développeur ? (Louis-Guillaume MORAND, Eric GRENON)

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some good advice, a lot of bullshit, and plenty of broken demos.

X.T: AI system devises first optimizations to sorting code in over a decade
X.ST: Writing efficient code was turned into a game, and the AI played to win.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: DeepMind created AlphaDev to optimise assembly code and improved some sorting algorithms.

X.T: A Critical Look at AI-Generated Software
X.ST: Coding with ChatGPT, GitHub Copilot, and other AI tools is both irresistible and dangerous

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A very classical analysis of AI tools for generating code.

X.T: Exploring Generative AI

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A list of well-thought-out ideas on AI-assisted coding.

X.T: Three things GenAI will not change about software delivery

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Generative AI will not change the fact that software development is not only coding, that it is a team work, and that we need to have some metrics.

X.T: Programmer’s Apprentice Season 2: Future Directions in AI-assisted Coding • Erik Meijer • YOW! 2023

ARTICLE.COMMENT: As usual, ErikMeijer has a provocative presentation, but this one has little worthwhile content, he describes only wellknown things.

X.T: Three types of AI-assisted programmers
X.ST: What matters isn’t just whether you use it, but how.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some advice on using code assistants: the less competent you are in coding, the more perilous it is to use them; if you know what you are doing, they may be helpful.

X.T: Github Copilot Does NOT Like This... (100% Local Free VSCode CoPilot)

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A demo fo Continue, an AI assistant for VSCode that can use different chat models, but the examples shown here are definitely not convincing.

X.T: Responsible AI pair programming with GitHub Copilot
X.ST: GitHub Copilot boosts developer productivity, but using it responsibly still requires good developer and DevSecOps practices.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The subtitle says it all.

X.T: Taking Copilot to difficult terrain

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A rather positive test of using GitHub Copilot to write some Rust unit tests.

X.T: Smarter, more efficient coding: GitHub Copilot goes beyond Codex with improved AI model
X.ST: We're thrilled to announce two major updates to GitHub Copilot code Completion's capabilities that will help developers work even more efficiently and effectively.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some advertisement for GitHub Copilot.

X.T: GitHub Copilot just got exponentially smarter

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of GitHub Copilot new features.

X.T: Be Careful Where you Send Your Code

ARTICLE.COMMENT: If you want to keep your code private, deploy your tools on premise. This is why Codeium proposes an Enterprise offering.

X.T: Why You Should Not Trust All the Numbers You See

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A critic of the metrics provided by Codeium’s competitors and how Codeium evaluates its product.

X.T: Introducing Codeium Live: Free, Forever Up-to-Date In-Browser Chat

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A chat answering questions on recent versions of some libraries.

X.T: GitHub Copilot’s Security Filters Don’t Work

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Demonstrating that GitHub Copilot’s claims to filter out unsafe code are bullshit.

X.T: Code Suggestion Attribution

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of how Codeium handles code licences: filter out code that is explicitly non-permissively licenced from training data, attribution of generated code…

X.T: What We Think of 2023 Q4 AI News

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some comments on GitHub Copilot announcements and its dependency to OpenAI, and further experimentation on the poor efficacy of CodeWhisperer.

X.T: The Effect of Generative AI on the Human-Tool Interface

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The vision of Codeium of how Generative AI helps the user and how this vision shapes the human-tool interface they implement.

X.T: Streamlining AI Code Chat with @ Mentions

ARTICLE.COMMENT: @ Mentions have been improved, but a real documentation of that feature would be helpful.

X.T: Termium: Codeium in the Terminal

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says it all.
